properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Wildfire smoke is causing poor air quality and reduced visibility at times. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. People with lung diseases, such as asthma and COPD, can be particularly sensitive to air pollution. They will generally experience more serious health effects at lower levels. Pollution can aggravate their diseases, leading to increased medication use, doctor and emergency room visits, and hospital visits. For more information please visit Alberta Health Services at www.albertahealthservices.ca/news/air.aspx. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-06-21T02:52:14-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, Alberta Environment and Parks, Alberta Health, Alberta Health Services, 2019-06-20T10:53:14-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3240073709.2019

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rainfall expected today. Precipitation associated with an approaching low pressure system will continue to impact areas near Lake Erie today. Latest analysis suggests that rainfall amounts will be less than originally anticipated as the bulk of the precipitation is expected to remain over Lake Erie and New York State. However, amounts of 15 to 30 mm are still possible. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-20T20:00:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-20T12:01:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1615739874.2019
Area: Simcoe - Delhi - Norfolk, Dunnville - Caledonia - Haldimand, St. Catharines - Grimsby - Northern Niagara Region, Niagara Falls - Welland - Southern Niagara Region

properties.Title: A Precautionary Water Advisory For The Resort Village Of Manitou Beach
properties.Summary:
Description: A Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory will be in effect from 4:30 am June 20, 2019 until further notice for the Resort Village of Manitou Beach. This advisory is for the entire Resort Village of Manitou Beach and for any individuals who may access water the Resort Village of Manitou Beach water system. The advisory is due to a planned SaskPower maintence power outage.
Expires: 2019-06-24T00:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK RV of Manitou Beach, 2019-06-19T17:15:55-06:00, 7769A591-7ACA-FACB-F1A1-A9A79FA46FCC
Area: Resort Village of Manitou Beach
properties.Author: SK RV of Manitou Beach

properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert - Wildfire Alert
properties.Summary:
Description: A wildfire is advancing and everyone in the area located north of Highway 697, south of the Peace River and west of Steep Hill Creek, also called Range Road 164, must immediately evacuate. ### People evacuating the area must register at the Reception Centre located at the Fort Vermilion Mackenzie County Office 4511 46 Ave. Fort Vermilion or call 780-927-3718. Please call the Reception Centre if you require parking for your RV or holiday trailer. More information is also available at www.facebook.com/Mackenzie-County-262409787134568/ for Mackenzie County residents. Check www.511.alberta.ca/region/Northern%20Alberta#:Alerts for more information on road conditions. Bring medication, blankets, sleeping bags, personal items and identification if possible.
Expires: 2019-06-26T16:12:08-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Alberta Emergency Management Agency on behalf of Mackenzie County, 2019-06-19T16:11:39-06:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-5863
Area: Mackenzie #23
properties.Author: Alberta Emergency Management Agency on behalf of Mackenzie County

properties.Title: Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory Alert Is Still In Effect For The Village Of Earl Grey.
properties.Summary:
Description: A Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory has been issued for the Village of Earl Grey. This advisory is for the entire community and for any individuals who may access water from the Village of Earl Grey’s water system. This advisory is in effect until further notice.
Expires: 2019-06-26T17:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Earl Grey, 2019-06-20T09:01:14-06:00, 6F347FFC-B3DD-9F95-6683-6F30F50F24A7
Area: Village of Earl Grey

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant rainfall expected today. Precipitation associated with an approaching low pressure system will continue to impact areas near Lake Erie beginning today. Amounts are expected to be highly variable with this weather system with rainfall amounts of 20 to 50 mm possible. Ponding of water in low-lying areas may occur. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-20T16:37:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-20T08:38:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2340497279.2019

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A wet weekend in store. Rain will begin over western Newfoundland Friday morning and then persist through Friday night and into Saturday. Total rainfall accumulations could exceed 50 millimeters for some areas by Saturday evening. Rain is expected to taper to showers Saturday night and into Sunday. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-06-20T21:32:22-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-20T13:33:22-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4199841017.2019

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Wet weather expected for Friday and Saturday. A low pressure system will slowly cross Nova Scotia on Friday and pass to the northeast of the province on Saturday. Rain ahead of this system will begin after midnight tonight in the southwest and spread to Cape Breton Island by Friday morning. The rain will then taper to showers on Friday night or Saturday. These showers may persist through the weekend over Cape Breton. Total rainfall amounts may reach or exceed 50 mm for this rainfall event. A rainfall warning has been issued for Cumberland County, and that warning may be extended to other counties with future updates. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-20T21:50:04-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-20T13:51:04-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3227610128.2019

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of about 10 cm is expected. Snow developed last night and will continue today and tonight over portions of Highway 93. Snowfall amounts of 10 cm are expected for the Icefield Parkway before snow tapers off Friday morning. ### Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-21T04:30:26-00:00

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Wet weather for New Brunswick Friday into Saturday. A weather system will pass over the Maritimes Friday into Saturday spreading rain throughout New Brunswick. Rain will begin tonight and continue into Friday night or Saturday morning. Latest forecast guidance indicates that amounts of up to 40 mm are likely in the heaviest rain for areas in this statement. Over southernmost New Brunswick, amounts are likely to reach or exceed 50 mm in the heaviest rain, and rainfall warnings have been issued there. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-20T21:49:25-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-20T13:50:25-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3290715077.2019
Area: Woodstock and Carleton County, Stanley - Doaktown - Blackville Area, Kent County, Kouchibouguac National Park, Miramichi and area
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. Rain, heavy at times with embedded thundershowers, is forecast to begin this evening and persist through the day on Friday before ending from west to east on Friday night or Saturday morning. Total rainfall amounts may reach or exceed 50 mm in the areas of heaviest rain. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-21T05:48:36-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-20T13:49:36-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0464517065.2019

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A long episode of rain, at times heavy, continues. A low pressure system over central Alberta will continue to bring periods of rain to west-central regions. Total rainfall amounts of 50 to 80 mm are expected. The heaviest rain will end in Edmonton later this morning with western regions ending on Friday. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Be prepared for possible winter conditions at higher elevations. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-21T04:25:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-20T12:26:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2441785504.2019

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Wet weather expected for Friday and Saturday. A low pressure system will pass through the Maritimes on Friday into Saturday and will spread rain, heavy at times, through the Island beginning in the early morning hours on Friday. The rain is forecast to persist through Friday night into Saturday before beginning to ease late Saturday night. Total rainfall amounts may reach or exceed 50 mm by the end of this rainfall event and rainfall warnings may be issued. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to PEstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #PEStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-20T21:50:32-00:00

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Wet weather expected this weekend. A low pressure system will slowly cross Nova Scotia on Friday before moving northeastward toward Newfoundland on Saturday. Rain ahead of this system will begin over the Magdalen Islands on Friday morning and will likely persist into Sunday as the low slowly departs. Total rainfall amounts from this system will likely reach or exceed 50 mm by the end of the event, and a rainfall warning may be issued with future updates. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-20T21:51:08-00:00
